posts.cooked:
Hi community!

I had an old Pixel 1 that I’d been keeping around until I could get the time to replace the screen and then backup properly. I had Signal installed with a number of conversations that didn’t make it across to my new iPhone, which is now registered to my number. After finally fixing the screen, I tried running Signal. I can’t remember why, but I upgraded it to the latest version, and also Android to v10 (it’s Verizon permalocked so I can’t use Lineage unfortunately )

When trying to view a conversation I get a crash like this, which seems to be needing an account identifier which is somehow missing in my local data:

Linking a device fails with a 401, presumably because of the ACI issue as it needs to phone home. So I tried to export the data to txt/json and I see that it also phones home:

01-04 18:47:39.813 10542 10554 I crime.securesm: Background concurrent copying GC freed 88773(3434KB) AllocSpace objects, 0(0B) LOS objects, 49% free, 23MB/46MB, paused 80us total

So I’m wondering if these issues are worthy of a bug report. Should old account data properly migrate to newer versions or is there a limit to the migration process? Does Signal need to phone home to export data?

I’m also wondering whether I should try downgrading the app to recover the data, or even if that’s possible? I installed the application via the Play Store.

Any advice appreciated. Also willing to help out with making bug reports or maybe some dev work if that would help.
